After a long wait of 12 years, the film Madha Gaja Raja, directed by Sundar C and featuring Vishal, Varalaxmi Sarathkumar, and Anjali, is set to release on Pongal 2025.

  • The film was initially supposed to release in 2013.
  • Delayed due to financial troubles faced by the producers.
  • It completed production in 2013 but remained unreleased for over a decade.
  • Director Sundar C expressed confidence in the film's entertainment value despite the long wait.

Actor-filmmaker Aparna Malladi passes away - 123telugu
summary:
Actor-filmmaker Aparna Malladi passes away

Published on: Jan 3, 2025 7:37 pm IST

Aparna Malladi, a renowned actor, filmmaker, and teacher, passed away in Los Angeles on January 2 after a long battle with cancer. She was 54 years old and had been undergoing treatment after relocating from India.

  • Aparna was well-known for her YouTube series 'Posh Poris' and her feature films including 'The Anushree Experiments' and 'Pellikuturu Party.'
  • She battled cancer for four years, with a relapse occurring two years ago.
  • Aparna made significant contributions to Telugu independent cinema and mentored several young filmmakers.
  • Her last film, 'Pellikuturu Party,' was released in 2022.
“Aparna’s untimely passing has left her friends and students in grief.”

This loss marks a significant moment in the Telugu cinema community, highlighting the impact of Aparna's work and dedication.
newTitle: Tribute to Actor-Filmmaker Aparna Malladi

title: Actor Allu Arjun granted conditional bail in Sandhya theatre’s Pushpa stampede case - The Hindu
summary:
Actor Allu Arjun granted conditional bail in Sandhya theatre’s Pushpa stampede case

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Actor Allu Arjun was granted conditional bail by the Nampally court of Hyderabad in connection with the ongoing investigation into the Sandhya 70 MM theatre stampede case, which resulted in one death during a screening of Pushpa 2.

  • Arjun was arrested on December 13, 2024, under charges of culpable homicide.
  • The court required the actor to submit two sureties of ₹50,000 each.
  • Conditions of the bail include visiting the local police station every Sunday for two months.
  • The proceedings regarding his judicial remand are adjourned until January 10.
newTitle: Actor Allu Arjun granted conditional bail in Sandhya theatre’s Pushpa stampede case

summary:
Allu Arjun Granted Regular Bail in Theatre Stampede Case

Actor Allu Arjun was granted regular bail by a local court in connection with a tragic stampede incident during the premiere of 'Pushpa 2'.

  • Allu Arjun was arrested following the December 4 stampede at the Sandhya 70MM theatre in Hyderabad.
  • The incident resulted in the death of a 35-year-old woman and the hospitalization of her 9-year-old son due to asphyxiation.
  • The stampede occurred as fans rushed to see Allu Arjun and music director Devi Sri Prasad.
  • Hyderabad Police filed charges against Allu Arjun and his security team under various sections of the law.
A 35-year-old woman died and her nine-year-old son was hospitalized due to asphyxiation after a huge crowd jostled.

title: Pongal 2025 Tamil Movie Releases: Madraskaaran, Madha Gaja Raja, Nesippaya to release on Pongal - The Indian Express
summary:
Pongal 2025 Movie Releases List: Several films are set to release and make the best use of the long holiday week.

Updated: January 3, 2025

Pongal releases are a time-honoured tradition. This year too, several films are set to release and make the best use of the long holiday week. While the much-expected biggie, Vidaamuyarchi, starring Ajith Kumar and Trisha, has backed out of the race, here's a list of Pongal releases.

  • Madraskaaran (January 10): Malayalam actor Shane Nigam's Tamil debut, directed by Vaali Mohan Das.
  • Vanangaan (January 10): Action drama film starring Arun Vijay, written and directed by Bala.
  • Madha Gaja Raja (January 12): Long-awaited release featuring Vishal, finally making its debut after a decade.
  • Nesippaya (January 14): Romantic thriller marking the debut of Akash Murali, directed by Vishnuvardhan.
  • Kadhalikka Neramillai (January 14): Romantic comedy directed by Kiruthiga Udhayanidhi with Jayam Ravi and Nithya Menon.
  • Sankrantiki Vasthunaam: Includes several Telugu releases to coincide with the Sankranthi weekend.
newTitle: Pongal 2025 Tamil Movie Releases: Key Films Announced

summary:

Publication Date: Jan 03, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Amitabh Bachchan honors the memory of significant Indian figures lost in 2024 through a heartfelt portrayal by cartoonist Satish Acharya.

  • Bachchan shared a post on social media remembering icons like Ratan Tata, Zakir Hussain, Manmohan Singh, and Shyam Benegal.
  • The artwork depicts them enjoying their passions in the afterlife, emphasizing unity among different communities.
  • The caption read: “A Parsi, a Muslim, a Sikh, and a Hindu passed away in 2024 and the whole nation mourned and remembered them only as Indians.”

title: Shah Rukh Khan hit with sarcastic dig by Abhijeet Bhattacharya: ‘He can sing his own songs, as it is he gets all the credit for them’ - The Indian Express
summary:

Controversial singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya recently discussed his relationship with Shah Rukh Khan, mentioning the public rift and the impact of trolling on their dynamic.

  • Abhijeet admits that their issues have been amplified by online trolling.
  • He sarcastically noted that Shah Rukh can both produce and sing his own songs.
  • He expressed frustration over being overshadowed by comments from trolls regarding his collaborations with SRK.
  • Abhijeet described SRK as the only true 'nationalist' among his contemporaries.
  • He shared personal anecdotes about his career shift following his success with SRK's films.
“Had they not, how would ‘Lungi Dance’ exist? He can produce and sing his own songs; as it is, they call my tracks ‘Shah Rukh Khan’s songs’.”

The article elaborates on the complexities of celebrity relationships and the influence of public opinion, particularly in the entertainment industry, highlighting how personal and professional dynamics can be affected by portrayal in social media.
